member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. If null, the markers are hidden when the data is dense, and shown for more widespread data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.Height
member.summary: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker.

summary.p: A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".
Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.
Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarker.Width
member.summary: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStates.Select
member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for a hovered point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2 as per the radiusPlus option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesHover.RadiusPlus
member.summary: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable visible feedback for selection.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaultsto the normal state's radius + 2.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.BubbleSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

summary.p: When using multiple axis, the ticks of two or more opposite axes will automatically be aligned by adding ticks to the axis or axes with the least ticks, as if tickAmount were specified.
This can be prevented by setting alignTicks to false. If the grid lines look messy, it's a good idea to hide them for the secondary axis by setting gridLineWidth to 0.

Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series.animation.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the outer chart area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the outer chart border.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the outer chart border.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.BorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the outer chart border.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.ClassName
member.summary: A CSS class name to apply to the charts container div, allowing unique CSS styling for each chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.ColorCount
member.summary: In styled mode, this sets how many colors the class names should rotate between. With ten colors, series (or points) are given class names like highcharts-color-0, highcharts-color-0 [...] highcharts-color-9. The equivalent in non-styled mode is to set colors using the colors setting.

summary.p: A text description of the chart.
If the Accessibility module is loaded, this is included by default as a long description of the chart and its contents in the hidden screen reader information region.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Events
member.summary: Event listeners for the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Height
member.summary: An explicit height for the chart. By default (when null) the height is calculated from the offset height of the containing element, or 400 pixels if the containing element's height is 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.IgnoreHiddenSeries
member.summary: If true, the axes will scale to the remaining visible series once one series is hidden. If false, hiding and showing a series will not affect the axes or the other series. For stacks, once one series within the stack is hidden, the rest of the stack will close in around it even if the axis is not affected.

summary.p: Whether to invert the axes so that the x axis is vertical and y axis is horizontal. When true, the x axis is reversed by default. If a bar series is present in the chart, it will be inverted automatically.
Inverting the chart doesn't have an effect if there are no cartesian series in the chart, or if the chart is polar.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Margin
member.summary:
The margin between the outer edge of the chart and the plot area. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom and marginLeft for shorthand setting of one option.
Since version 2.1, the margin is 0 by default. The actual space is dynamically calculated from the offset of axis labels, axis title, title, subtitle and legend in addition to the spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options. Defaults to [null].

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.MarginBottom
member.summary: The margin between the bottom outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingBottom.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.MarginLeft
member.summary: The margin between the left outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingLeft.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.MarginRight
member.summary: The margin between the right outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingRight.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.MarginTop
member.summary: The margin between the top outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingTop.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Options3d
member.summary: Options to render charts in 3 dimensions. This feature requires highcharts-3d.js, found in the download package or online at code.highcharts.com/highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PanKey
member.summary: Allows setting a key to switch between zooming and panning.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Panning
member.summary: Allow panning in a chart. Best used with panKey to combine zooming and panning.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PinchType
member.summary: Equivalent to zoomType, but for multitouch gestures only. By default, the pinchType is the same as the zoomType setting. However, pinching can be enabled separately in some cases, for example in stock charts where a mouse drag pans the chart, while pinching is enabled. When tooltip.followTouchMove is true, pinchType only applies to two-finger touches.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PlotBackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PlotBackgroundImage
member.summary: The URL for an image to use as the plot background. To set an image as the background for the entire chart, set a CSS background image to the container element. Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PlotBorderColor
member.summary: The color of the inner chart or plot area border.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PlotBorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the plot area border.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.PlotShadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Polar
member.summary: When true, cartesian charts like line, spline, area and column are transformed into the polar coordinate system. Requires highcharts-more.js.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Reflow
member.summary: Whether to reflow the chart to fit the width of the container div on resizing the window.

summary.p: The HTML element where the chart will be rendered. If it is a string, the element by that id is used. The HTML element can also be passed by direct reference.
When using the Highcharts.chart constructor, the renderTo is given as a parameter, and can be skipped in the options set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.ResetZoomButton
member.summary: The button that appears after a selection zoom, allowing the user to reset zoom.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.SelectionMarkerFill
member.summary: The background color of the marker square when selecting (zooming in on) an area of the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the outer chart area. Requires that backgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.ShowAxes
member.summary: Whether to show the axes initially. This only applies to empty charts where series are added dynamically, as axes are automatically added to cartesian series.

summary.p: The space between the bottom edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).
The space between the left edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).
The space between the right edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).
The space between the top edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Style
member.summary: Additional CSS styles to apply inline to the container div. Note that since the default font styles are applied in the renderer, it is ignorant of the individual chart options and must be set globally.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Type
member.summary: The default series type for the chart. Can be any of the chart types listed under plotOptions.

summary.p: A text description of the chart type.
If the Accessibility module is loaded, this will be included in the description of the chart in the screen reader information region.
Highcharts will by default attempt to guess the chart type, but for more complex charts it is recommended to specify this property for clarity.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.Width
member.summary: An explicit width for the chart. By default (when null) the width is calculated from the offset width of the containing element.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Chart.ZoomType
member.summary: Decides in what dimensions the user can zoom by dragging the mouse. Can be one of x, y or xy.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartEvents.AddSeries
member.summary: Fires when a series is added to the chart after load time, using the addSeries method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Through event.options you can access the series options that was passed to the addSeries method. Returning false prevents the series from being added.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartEvents.AfterPrint
member.summary: Fires after a chart is printed through the context menu item or the Chart.print method. Requires the exporting module.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartEvents.BeforePrint
member.summary: Fires before a chart is printed through the context menu item or the Chart.print method. Requires the exporting module.

summary.p: Fires when clicking on the plot background. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

Information on the clicked spot can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' value at the clicked spot. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.

Fires when a drilldown point is clicked, before the new series is added. This event is also utilized for async drilldown, where the seriesOptions are not added by option, but rather loaded async. Note that when clicking a category label to trigger multiple series drilldown, one drilldown event is triggered per point in the category.
Event arguments:

dl.dd: If a category label was clicked, which index.
The originating point.
The original browser event (usually click) that triggered the drilldown.
If a category label was clicked, this array holds all points corresponing to the category.
Options for the new series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartEvents.Drillup
member.summary: Fires when drilling up from a drilldown series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartEvents.Drillupall
member.summary: In a chart with multiple drilldown series, this event fires after all the series have been drilled up.

summary.p: Fires when the chart is finished loading. Since v4.2.2, it also waits for images to be loaded, for example from point markers. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
There is also a second parameter to the chart constructor where a callback function can be passed to be executed on chart.load.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartEvents.Redraw
member.summary: Fires when the chart is redrawn, either after a call to chart.redraw() or after an axis, series or point is modified with the redraw option set to true. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

summary.p: Fires when an area of the chart has been selected. Selection is enabled by setting the chart's zoomType. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action for the selection event is to zoom the chart to the selected area. It can be prevented by calling event.preventDefault().

Information on the selected area can be found through event.xAxis and event.yAxis, which are arrays containing the axes of each dimension and each axis' min and max values. The primary axes are event.xAxis[0] and event.yAxis[0]. Remember the unit of a datetime axis is milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00.
summary.pre: selection: function(event) {// log the min and max of the primary, datetime x-axisconsole.log(Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].min),Highcharts.dateFormat('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', event.xAxis[0].max));// log the min and max of the y axisconsole.log(event.yAxis[0].min, event.yAxis[0].max);}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.Alpha
member.summary: One of the two rotation angles for the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.Beta
member.summary: One of the two rotation angles for the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.Depth
member.summary: The total depth of the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.Enabled
member.summary: Wether to render the chart using the 3D functionality.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.FitToPlot
member.summary: Whether the 3d box should automatically adjust to the chart plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.Frame
member.summary: Provides the option to draw a frame around the charts by defining a bottom, front and back panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3d.ViewDistance
member.summary: Defines the distance the viewer is standing in front of the chart, this setting is important to calculate the perspective effect in column and scatter charts.It is not used for 3D pie charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrame.Back
member.summary: Defines the back panel of the frame around 3D charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrame.Bottom
member.summary: The bottom of the frame around a 3D chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrame.Side
member.summary: The side for the frame around a 3D chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrameBack.Color
member.summary: The color of the panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrameBack.Size
member.summary: Thickness of the panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrameBottom.Color
member.summary: The color of the panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrameBottom.Size
member.summary: The thickness of the panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrameSide.Color
member.summary: The color of the panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartOptions3dFrameSide.Size
member.summary: The thickness of the panel.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButton.Position
member.summary: The position of the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButton.RelativeTo
member.summary: What frame the button should be placed related to. Can be either "plot" or "chart".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButton.Theme
member.summary: A collection of attributes for the button. The object takes SVG attributes like fill, stroke, stroke-width or r, the border radius. The theme also supports style, a collection of CSS properties for the text. Equivalent attributes for the hover state are given in theme.states.hover.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButtonPosition.Align
member.summary: The heatmap series type. This series type is available both in Highcharts and Highmaps.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButtonPosition.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButtonPosition.X
member.summary: The horizontal offset of the button

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ChartResetZoomButtonPosition.Y
member.summary: The vertical offset of the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

summary.p: The color of the border surrounding each column or bar.
In styled mode, the border stroke can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the border surrounding each column or bar.

summary.p: The width of the border surrounding each column or bar.
In styled mode, the stroke width can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

summary.p: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

In styled mode, the series color can be set with the .highcharts-series, .highcharts-color-{n}, .highcharts-{type}-series or .highcharts-series-{n} class, or individual classes given by the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.ColorByPoint
member.summary: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.DataLabels
member.summary: Extended data labels for range series types. Range series data labels have no x and y options. Instead, they have xLow, xHigh, yLow and yHigh options to allow the higher and lower data label sets individually.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Depth
member.summary: Depth of the columns in a 3D column chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.EdgeColor
member.summary: 3D columns only. The color of the edges. Similar to borderColor, except it defaults to the same color as the column.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.EdgeWidth
member.summary: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.GroupPadding
member.summary: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.GroupZPadding
member.summary: The spacing between columns on the Z Axis in a 3D chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Grouping
member.summary: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.MaxPointWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowed pixel width for a column, translated to the height of a bar in a bar chart. This prevents the columns from becoming too wide when there is a small number of points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.MinPointLength
member.summary: The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

summary.p: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.
Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.PointIntervalUnit
member.summary: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.PointPadding
member.summary: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.PointRange
member.summary: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.PointWidth
member.summary: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.XAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.YAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.ClassName
member.summary: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Color
member.summary: Individual color for the point. By default the color is pulled from the global colors array.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.ColorIndex
member.summary: Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.DataLabels
member.summary: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels

summary.p: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Drilldown
member.summary: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Events
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.High
member.summary: The high or maximum value for each data point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Id
member.summary: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Labelrank
member.summary: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Low
member.summary: The low or minimum value for each data point.

summary.p: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

If the xAxis.type is set to category, and no categories option exists, the category will be pulled from the point.name of the last series defined. For multiple series, best practice however is to define xAxis.categories.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.Selected
member.summary: Whether the data point is selected initially.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesData.X
member.summary: The x value of the point. For datetime axes, the X value is the timestamp in milliseconds since 1970.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.XHigh
member.summary: X offset of the higher data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.XLow
member.summary: X offset of the lower data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.YHigh
member.summary: Y offset of the higher data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.YLow
member.summary: Y offset of the lower data labels relative to the point value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnrangeSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

summary.p: The color of the border surrounding each column or bar.
In styled mode, the border stroke can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the border surrounding each column or bar.

summary.p: The width of the border surrounding each column or bar.
In styled mode, the stroke width can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

summary.p: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

In styled mode, the series color can be set with the .highcharts-series, .highcharts-color-{n}, .highcharts-{type}-series or .highcharts-series-{n} class, or individual classes given by the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.ColorByPoint
member.summary: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Depth
member.summary: Depth of the columns in a 3D column chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.EdgeColor
member.summary: 3D columns only. The color of the edges. Similar to borderColor, except it defaults to the same color as the column.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.EdgeWidth
member.summary: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.GroupPadding
member.summary: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.GroupZPadding
member.summary: The spacing between columns on the Z Axis in a 3D chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Grouping
member.summary: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.MaxPointWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowed pixel width for a column, translated to the height of a bar in a bar chart. This prevents the columns from becoming too wide when there is a small number of points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.MinPointLength
member.summary: The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.NegativeColor
member.summary: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

summary.p: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.
Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.PointIntervalUnit
member.summary: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.PointPadding
member.summary: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.PointRange
member.summary: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.PointWidth
member.summary: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

summary.p: When this is true, the series will not cause the Y axis to cross the zero plane (or threshold option) unless the data actually crosses the plane.
For example, if softThreshold is false, a series of 0, 1, 2, 3 will make the Y axis show negative values according to the minPadding option. If softThreshold is true, the Y axis starts at 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Stack
member.summary: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the columns, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the columns extend from the padding Y axis minimum.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.XAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.YAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.ClassName
member.summary: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Color
member.summary: Individual color for the point. By default the color is pulled from the global colors array.
