member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.ColorIndex
member.summary: Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.DataLabels
member.summary: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels

summary.p: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Drilldown
member.summary: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Events
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Id
member.summary: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Labelrank
member.summary: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

summary.p: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

If the xAxis.type is set to category, and no categories option exists, the category will be pulled from the point.name of the last series defined. For multiple series, best practice however is to define xAxis.categories.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Selected
member.summary: Whether the data point is selected initially.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.X
member.summary: The x value of the point. For datetime axes, the X value is the timestamp in milliseconds since 1970.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesData.Y
member.summary: The y value of the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ColumnSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Credits.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to show the credits text.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Credits.Href
member.summary: The URL for the credits label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Credits.Position
member.summary: Position configuration for the credits label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Credits.Style
member.summary: CSS styles for the credits label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Credits.Text
member.summary: The text for the credits label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.CreditsPosition.Align
member.summary: Horizontal alignment of the credits.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.CreditsPosition.VerticalAlign
member.summary: Vertical alignment of the credits.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.CreditsPosition.X
member.summary: Horizontal pixel offset of the credits.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.CreditsPosition.Y
member.summary: Vertical pixel offset of the credits.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.Columns
member.summary: A two-dimensional array representing the input data on tabular form. This input can be used when the data is already parsed, for example from a grid view component. Each cell can be a string or number. If not switchRowsAndColumns is set, the columns are interpreted as series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.Complete
member.summary: The callback that is evaluated when the data is finished loading, optionally from an external source, and parsed. The first argument passed is a finished chart options object, containing the series. These options can be extended with additional options and passed directly to the chart constructor.

summary.p: A comma delimited string to be parsed. Related options are startRow, endRow, startColumn and endColumn to delimit what part of the table is used. The lineDelimiter and itemDelimiter options define the CSV delimiter formats.

The built-in CSV parser doesn't support all flavours of CSV, so in some cases it may be necessary to use an external CSV parser. See this example of parsing CSV through the MIT licensed Papa Parse library.
Which of the predefined date formats in Date.prototype.dateFormats to use to parse date values. Defaults to a best guess based on what format gives valid and ordered dates.

Valid options include:
YYYY-mm-dd
dd/mm/YYYY
mm/dd/YYYY
dd/mm/YY
mm/dd/YY

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.DecimalPoint
member.summary: The decimal point used for parsing numbers in the CSV.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.EndColumn
member.summary: In tabular input data, the last column (indexed by 0) to use. Defaults to the last column containing data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.EndRow
member.summary: In tabular input data, the last row (indexed by 0) to use. Defaults to the last row containing data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.FirstRowAsNames
member.summary: Whether to use the first row in the data set as series names.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.GoogleSpreadsheetKey
member.summary: The key for a Google Spreadsheet to load. See general information on GS.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.GoogleSpreadsheetWorksheet
member.summary: The Google Spreadsheet worksheet to use in combination with googleSpreadsheetKey. The available id's from your sheet can be read from https://spreadsheets.google.com/feeds/worksheets/{key}/public/basic

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.ItemDelimiter
member.summary: Item or cell delimiter for parsing CSV. Defaults to the tab character \t if a tab character is found in the CSV string, if not it defaults to ,.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.LineDelimiter
member.summary: Line delimiter for parsing CSV.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.ParseDate
member.summary: A callback function to parse string representations of dates into JavaScript timestamps. Should return an integer timestamp on success.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.Parsed
member.summary: A callback function to access the parsed columns, the two-dimentional input data array directly, before they are interpreted into series data and categories. Return false to stop completion, or call this.complete() to continue async.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.Rows
member.summary: The same as the columns input option, but defining rows intead of columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.SeriesMapping
member.summary: An array containing object with Point property names along with what column id the property should be taken from.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.StartColumn
member.summary: In tabular input data, the first column (indexed by 0) to use.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.StartRow
member.summary: In tabular input data, the first row (indexed by 0) to use.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.SwitchRowsAndColumns
member.summary: Switch rows and columns of the input data, so that this.columns effectively becomes the rows of the data set, and the rows are interpreted as series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Data.Table
member.summary: A HTML table or the id of such to be parsed as input data. Related options are startRow, endRow, startColumn and endColumn to delimit what part of the table is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Drilldown.ActiveAxisLabelStyle
member.summary: Additional styles to apply to the X axis label for a point that has drilldown data. By default it is underlined and blue to invite to interaction.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Drilldown.ActiveDataLabelStyle
member.summary: Additional styles to apply to the data label of a point that has drilldown data. By default it is underlined and blue to invite to interaction.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Drilldown.AllowPointDrilldown
member.summary: When this option is false, clicking a single point will drill down all points in the same category, equivalent to clicking the X axis label.

summary.p: Set the animation for all drilldown animations. Animation of a drilldown occurs when drilling between a column point and a column series, or a pie slice and a full pie series. Drilldown can still be used between series and points of different types, but animation will not occur.

The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Drilldown.DrillUpButton
member.summary: Options for the drill up button that appears when drilling down on a series. The text for the button is defined in lang.drillUpText.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Drilldown.Series
member.summary: An array of series configurations for the drill down. Each series configuration uses the same syntax as the series option set. These drilldown series are hidden by default. The drilldown series is linked to the parent series' point by its id.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.DrilldownDrillUpButton.Position
member.summary: Positioning options for the button within the relativeTo box. Available properties are x, y, align and verticalAlign.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.DrilldownDrillUpButton.RelativeTo
member.summary: What box to align the button to. Can be either "plotBox" or "spacingBox".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.DrilldownDrillUpButton.Theme
member.summary: A collection of attributes for the button. The object takes SVG attributes like fill, stroke, stroke-width or r, the border radius. The theme also supports style, a collection of CSS properties for the text. Equivalent attributes for the hover state are given in theme.states.hover.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Color
member.summary: The main color of the bars. This can be overridden by stemColor and whiskerColor individually.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.ColorByPoint
member.summary: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Depth
member.summary: Depth of the columns in a 3D column chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.EdgeColor
member.summary: 3D columns only. The color of the edges. Similar to borderColor, except it defaults to the same color as the column.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.EdgeWidth
member.summary: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.GroupZPadding
member.summary: The spacing between columns on the Z Axis in a 3D chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line surrounding the box. If any of stemWidth, medianWidth or whiskerWidth are null, the lineWidth also applies to these lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The parent series of the error bar. The default value links it to the previous series. Otherwise, use the id of the parent series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.MaxPointWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowed pixel width for a column, translated to the height of a bar in a bar chart. This prevents the columns from becoming too wide when there is a small number of points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.NegativeColor
member.summary: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

summary.p: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.
Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.PointIntervalUnit
member.summary: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.PointPadding
member.summary: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.PointRange
member.summary: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.PointWidth
member.summary: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.StemColor
member.summary: The color of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the series color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.StemDashStyle
member.summary: The dash style of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.StemWidth
member.summary: The width of the stem, the vertical line extending from the box to the whiskers. If null, the width is inherited from the lineWidth option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.WhiskerColor
member.summary: The color of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general series color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.WhiskerLength
member.summary: The length of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. It can be a numerical pixel value, or a percentage value of the box width. Set 0 to disable whiskers.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.WhiskerWidth
member.summary: The line width of the whiskers, the horizontal lines marking low and high values. When null, the general lineWidth applies.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.XAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.YAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.ClassName
member.summary: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.Color
member.summary: Individual color for the point. By default the color is pulled from the global colors array.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.ColorIndex
member.summary: Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}.

summary.p: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.Events
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.High
member.summary: The high or maximum value for each data point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.Id
member.summary: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.Labelrank
member.summary: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.Low
member.summary: The low or minimum value for each data point.

summary.p: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

If the xAxis.type is set to category, and no categories option exists, the category will be pulled from the point.name of the last series defined. For multiple series, best practice however is to define xAxis.categories.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.Selected
member.summary: Whether the data point is selected initially.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesData.X
member.summary: The x value of the point. For datetime axes, the X value is the timestamp in milliseconds since 1970.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ErrorbarSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

summary.p: Experimental setting to allow HTML inside the chart (added through the useHTML options), directly in the exported image. This allows you to preserve complicated HTML structures like tables or bi-directional text in exported charts.

Disclaimer: The HTML is rendered in a foreignObject tag in the generated SVG. The official export server is based on PhantomJS, which supports this, but other SVG clients, like Batik, does not support it. This also applies to downloaded SVG that you want to open in a desktop client.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Buttons
member.summary: Options for the export related buttons, print and export. In addition to the default buttons listed here, custom buttons can be added. See navigation.buttonOptions for general options.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.ChartOptions
member.summary: Additional chart options to be merged into an exported chart. For example, a common use case is to add data labels to improve readaility of the exported chart, or to add a printer-friendly color scheme.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to enable the exporting module. Disabling the module will hide the context button, but API methods will still be available.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Error
member.summary: Function to call if the offline-exporting module fails to export a chart on the client side, and fallbackToExportServer is disabled. If left undefined, an exception is thrown instead.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.FallbackToExportServer
member.summary: Whether or not to fall back to the export server if the offline-exporting module is unable to export the chart on the client side.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Filename
member.summary: The filename, without extension, to use for the exported chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.FormAttributes
member.summary: An object containing additional attributes for the POST form that sends the SVG to the export server. For example, a target can be set to make sure the generated image is received in another frame, or a custom enctype or encoding can be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.LibURL
member.summary: Path where Highcharts will look for export module dependencies to load on demand if they don't already exist on window.Should currently point to location of CanVG library, RGBColor.js, jsPDF and svg2pdf.js, required for client side export in certain browsers.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.PrintMaxWidth
member.summary: When printing the chart from the menu item in the burger menu, if the on-screen chart exceeds this width, it is resized. After printing or cancelled, it is restored. The default width makes the chart fit into typical paper format. Note that this does not affect the chart when printing the web page as a whole.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Scale
member.summary: Defines the scale or zoom factor for the exported image compared to the on-screen display. While for instance a 600px wide chart may look good on a website, it will look bad in print. The default scale of 2 makes this chart export to a 1200px PNG or JPG.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.SourceHeight
member.summary: Analogous to sourceWidth

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.SourceWidth
member.summary: The width of the original chart when exported, unless an explicit chart.width is set. The width exported raster image is then multiplied by scale.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Type
member.summary: Default MIME type for exporting if chart.exportChart() is called without specifying a type option. Possible values are image/png, image/jpeg, application/pdf and image/svg+xml.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Url
member.summary: The URL for the server module converting the SVG string to an image format. By default this points to Highchart's free web service.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Exporting.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of charts exported to PNG or JPG. As of Highcharts 3.0, the default pixel width is a function of the chart.width or exporting.sourceWidth and the exporting.scale.

summary.p: Options for the export button.
In styled mode, export button styles can be applied with the .highcharts-contextbutton class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Align
member.summary: Alignment for the buttons.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Enabled
member.summary: Whether to enable buttons.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Height
member.summary: Pixel height of the buttons.

summary.p: A collection of config options for the menu items. Each options object consists of a text option which is a string to show in the menu item, as well as an onclick parameter which is a callback function to run on click.

By default, there is the "Print" menu item plus one menu item for each of the available export types. Menu items can be customized by defining a new array of items and assigning null to unwanted positions (see override example below).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Onclick
member.summary: A click handler callback to use on the button directly instead of the popup menu.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Symbol
member.summary: The symbol for the button. Points to a definition function in the Highcharts.Renderer.symbols collection. The default exportIcon function is part of the exporting module.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolFill
member.summary: See navigation.buttonOptions => symbolFill.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolSize
member.summary: The pixel size of the symbol on the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolStroke
member.summary: The color of the symbol's stroke or line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolStrokeWidth
member.summary: The pixel stroke width of the symbol on the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolX
member.summary: The x position of the center of the symbol inside the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.SymbolY
member.summary: The y position of the center of the symbol inside the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Text
member.summary: A text string to add to the individual button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Theme
member.summary: A configuration object for the button theme. The object accepts SVG properties like stroke-width, stroke and fill. Tri-state button styles are supported by the states.hover and states.select objects.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the buttons. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of the button.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.X
member.summary: The horizontal position of the button relative to the align option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ExportingButtonsContextButton.Y
member.summary: The vertical offset of the button's position relative to its verticalAlign. .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

summary.p: The color of the border surrounding each slice. When null, the border takes the same color as the slice fill. This can be used together with a borderWidth to fill drawing gaps created by antialiazing artefacts in borderless pies.
In styled mode, the border stroke is given in the .highcharts-point class.
The width of the border surrounding each slice.

When setting the border width to 0, there may be small gaps between the slices due to SVG antialiasing artefacts. To work around this, keep the border width at 0.5 or 1, but set the borderColor to null instead.
In styled mode, the border stroke width is given in the .highcharts-point class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Center
member.summary: The center of the series. By default, it is centered in the middle of the plot area, so it fills the plot area height.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to use instead of the global colors.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Depth
member.summary: The thickness of a 3D pie. Requires highcharts-3d.js

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Height
member.summary: The height of the funnel or pyramid. If it is a number it defines the pixel height, if it is a percentage string it is the percentage of the plot area height.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.MinSize
member.summary: The minimum size for a pie in response to auto margins. The pie will try to shrink to make room for data labels in side the plot area, but only to this size.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.NeckHeight
member.summary: The height of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area height.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.NeckWidth
member.summary: The width of the neck, the lower part of the funnel. A number defines pixel width, a percentage string defines a percentage of the plot area width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Reversed
member.summary: A reversed funnel has the widest area down. A reversed funnel with no neck width and neck height is a pyramid.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Since 2.1, pies are not shown in the legend by default.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.SlicedOffset
member.summary: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should it be moved?.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.Width
member.summary: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.ClassName
member.summary: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Color
member.summary: Individual color for the point. By default the color is pulled from the global colors array.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.ColorIndex
member.summary: Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.DataLabels
member.summary: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels

summary.p: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Drilldown
member.summary: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Events
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Id
member.summary: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Labelrank
member.summary: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.LegendIndex
member.summary: The sequential index of the data point in the legend.

summary.p: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

If the xAxis.type is set to category, and no categories option exists, the category will be pulled from the point.name of the last series defined. For multiple series, best practice however is to define xAxis.categories.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Selected
member.summary: Whether the data point is selected initially.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesData.Y
member.summary: The y value of the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

summary.p: The color of the line connecting the data label to the pie slice. The default color is the same as the point's color.
In styled mode, the connector stroke is given in the .highcharts-data-label-connector class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.ConnectorPadding
member.summary: The distance from the data label to the connector.

summary.p: The width of the line connecting the data label to the pie slice.
In styled mode, the connector stroke width is given in the .highcharts-data-label-connector class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Distance
member.summary: The distance of the data label from the pie's edge. Negative numbers put the data label on top of the pie slices. Connectors are only shown for data labels outside the pie.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.FunnelSeriesDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.
