member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

summary.p: When this is true, the series will not cause the Y axis to cross the zero plane (or threshold option) unless the data actually crosses the plane.
For example, if softThreshold is false, a series of 0, 1, 2, 3 will make the Y axis show negative values according to the minPadding option. If softThreshold is true, the Y axis starts at 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.Threshold
member.summary: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatter.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. If null, the markers are hidden when the data is dense, and shown for more widespread data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.Height
member.summary: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker.

summary.p: A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".
Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.
Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarker.Width
member.summary: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStates.Select
member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for a hovered point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2 as per the radiusPlus option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesHover.RadiusPlus
member.summary: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesSelect.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable visible feedback for selection.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesSelect.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesSelect.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesSelect.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterMarkerStatesSelect.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaultsto the normal state's radius + 2.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsScatterZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

summary.p: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

In styled mode, the series color can be set with the .highcharts-series, .highcharts-color-{n}, .highcharts-{type}-series or .highcharts-series-{n} class, or individual classes given by the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.ConnectEnds
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.ConnectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, even if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.DashStyle
member.summary:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
Solid
ShortDash
ShortDot
ShortDashDot
ShortDashDotDot
Dot
Dash
LongDash
DashDot
LongDashDot
LongDashDotDot

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Linecap
member.summary: The line cap used for line ends and line joins on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

summary.p: Options for the point markers of line-like series. Properties like fillColor, lineColor and lineWidth define the visual appearance of the markers. Other series types, like column series, don't have markers, but have visual options on the series level instead.
In styled mode, the markers can be styled with the .highcharts-point, .highcharts-point-hover and .highcharts-point-select class names.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.NegativeColor
member.summary: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

summary.p: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.
Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.PointIntervalUnit
member.summary: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

summary.p: When this is true, the series will not cause the Y axis to cross the zero plane (or threshold option) unless the data actually crosses the plane.
For example, if softThreshold is false, a series of 0, 1, 2, 3 will make the Y axis show negative values according to the minPadding option. If softThreshold is true, the Y axis starts at 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Step
member.summary: Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Prior to 2.3.5, only left was supported.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Threshold
member.summary: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker. If null, the markers are hidden when the data is dense, and shown for more widespread data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.Height
member.summary: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a width must also be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker.

summary.p: A predefined shape or symbol for the marker. When null, the symbol is pulled from options.symbols. Other possible values are "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down".
Additionally, the URL to a graphic can be given on this form: "url(graphic.png)". Note that for the image to be applied to exported charts, its URL needs to be accessible by the export server.
Custom callbacks for symbol path generation can also be added to Highcharts.SVGRenderer.prototype.symbols. The callback is then used by its method name, as shown in the demo.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarker.Width
member.summary: Image markers only. Set the image width explicitly. When using this option, a height must also be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStates.Select
member.summary: The appearance of the point marker when selected. In order to allow a point to be selected, set the series.allowPointSelect option to true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the point marker.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the marker in hover state.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for a hovered point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaults to the normal state's radius + 2 as per the radiusPlus option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesHover.RadiusPlus
member.summary: The number of pixels to increase the radius of the hovered point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable visible feedback for selection.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.FillColor
member.summary: The fill color of the point marker.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.LineColor
member.summary: The color of the point marker's outline. When null, the series' or point's color is used.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the point marker's outline.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesMarkerStatesSelect.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the point marker. In hover state, it defaultsto the normal state's radius + 2.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.DataLabels
member.summary: Data labels for the gauge. For gauges, the data labels are enabled by default and shown in a bordered box below the point.

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Linecap
member.summary: Whether the strokes of the solid gauge should be round or square.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Overshoot
member.summary: Allow the dial to overshoot the end of the perimeter axis by this many degrees. Say if the gauge axis goes from 0 to 60, a value of 100, or 1000, will show 5 degrees beyond the end of the axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to false for gauge series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Threshold
member.summary: The threshold or base level for the gauge.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgauge.Wrap
member.summary: When this option is true, the dial will wrap around the axes. For instance, in a full-range gauge going from 0 to 360, a value of 400 will point to 40. When wrap is false, the dial stops at 360.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the gauge's data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the gauge data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the center of the gauge.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. A value of 2 display them behind the dial.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSolidgaugeEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

summary.p: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

In styled mode, the series color can be set with the .highcharts-series, .highcharts-color-{n}, .highcharts-{type}-series or .highcharts-series-{n} class, or individual classes given by the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.ConnectEnds
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.ConnectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, even if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.DashStyle
member.summary:
A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include:
Solid
ShortDash
ShortDot
ShortDashDot
ShortDashDotDot
Dot
Dash
LongDash
DashDot
LongDashDot
LongDashDotDot

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Linecap
member.summary: The line cap used for line ends and line joins on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

summary.p: Options for the point markers of line-like series. Properties like fillColor, lineColor and lineWidth define the visual appearance of the markers. Other series types, like column series, don't have markers, but have visual options on the series level instead.
In styled mode, the markers can be styled with the .highcharts-point, .highcharts-point-hover and .highcharts-point-select class names.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.NegativeColor
member.summary: The color for the parts of the graph or points that are below the threshold.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

summary.p: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.
Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.PointIntervalUnit
member.summary: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

summary.p: When this is true, the series will not cause the Y axis to cross the zero plane (or threshold option) unless the data actually crosses the plane.
For example, if softThreshold is false, a series of 0, 1, 2, 3 will make the Y axis show negative values according to the minPadding option. If softThreshold is true, the Y axis starts at 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Threshold
member.summary: The threshold, also called zero level or base level. For line type series this is only used in conjunction with negativeColor.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSpline.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.PlotOptionsSplineDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.
