member.summary: Use HTML to render the contents of the tooltip instead of SVG. Using HTML allows advanced formatting like tables and images in the tooltip. It is also recommended for rtl languages as it works around rtl bugs in early Firefox.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Tooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Tooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Tooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.Tooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.AllowDrillToNode
member.summary: When enabled the user can click on a point which is a parent and zoom in on its children.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.AlternateStartingDirection
member.summary: Enabling this option will make the treemap alternate the drawing direction between vertical and horizontal.The next levels starting direction will always be the opposite of the previous.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.BorderColor
member.summary: The color of the border surrounding each tree map item.

summary.p: The width of the border surrounding each column or bar.
In styled mode, the stroke width can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Color
member.summary: The main color of the series. In heat maps this color is rarely used, as we mostly use the color to denote the value of each point. Unless options are set in the colorAxis, the default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.ColorByPoint
member.summary: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.CropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.InteractByLeaf
member.summary: This option decides if the user can interact with the parent nodes or just the leaf nodes. When this option is undefined, it will be true by default. However when allowDrillToNode is true, then it will be false by default.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.LayoutAlgorithm
member.summary: This option decides which algorithm is used for setting position and dimensions of the points. Can be one of sliceAndDice, stripes, squarified or strip.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.LayoutStartingDirection
member.summary: Defines which direction the layout algorithm will start drawing. Possible values are "vertical" and "horizontal".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.LevelIsConstant
member.summary: Used together with the levels and allowDrillToNode options. When set to false the first level visible when drilling is considered to be level one. Otherwise the level will be the same as the tree structure.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Levels
member.summary: Set options on specific levels. Takes precedence over series options, but not point options.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.MaxPointWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowed pixel width for a column, translated to the height of a bar in a bar chart. This prevents the columns from becoming too wide when there is a small number of points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this series type or specific series item in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.SortIndex
member.summary: The sort index of the point inside the treemap level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.TurboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Set it to 0 disable.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.XAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.YAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.ClassName
member.summary: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Color
member.summary: The color of the point. In heat maps the point color is rarely set explicitly, as we use the color to denote the value. Options for this are set in the colorAxis configuration.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.ColorIndex
member.summary: Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.ColorValue
member.summary: Serves a purpose only if a colorAxis object is defined in the chart options. This value will decide which color the point gets from the scale of the colorAxis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.DataLabels
member.summary: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels

summary.p: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Drilldown
member.summary: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Events
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Id
member.summary: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Labelrank
member.summary: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

summary.p: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

If the xAxis.type is set to category, and no categories option exists, the category will be pulled from the point.name of the last series defined. For multiple series, best practice however is to define xAxis.categories.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Parent
member.summary: Only for treemap. Use this option to build a tree structure. The value should be the id of the point which is the parent. If no points has a matching id, or this option is undefined, then the parent will be set to the root.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Selected
member.summary: Whether the data point is selected initially.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesData.Value
member.summary: The value of the point, resulting in a relative area of the point in the treemap.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: Whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.BorderColor
member.summary: Can set a borderColor on all points which lies on the same level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.BorderWidth
member.summary: Can set the borderWidth on all points which lies on the same level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.Color
member.summary: Can set a color on all points which lies on the same level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.DataLabels
member.summary: Can set the options of dataLabels on each point which lies on the level.plotOptions.treemap.dataLabels for possible values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.LayoutAlgorithm
member.summary: Can set the layoutAlgorithm option on a specific level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.LayoutStartingDirection
member.summary: Can set the layoutStartingDirection option on a specific level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesLevels.Level
member.summary: Decides which level takes effect from the options set in the levels object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.HeaderFormat
member.summary: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.PointFormat
member.summary: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.TreemapSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.AllowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices.

summary.p: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. The animation can also be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods.The following properties are supported:

dl.dd: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.
A string reference to an easing function set on the Math object. See the easing demo.

summary.p: Due to poor performance, animation is disabled in old IE browsers for column charts and polar charts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.AnimationLimit
member.summary: For some series, there is a limit that shuts down initial animation by default when the total number of points in the chart is too high. For example, for a column chart and its derivatives, animation doesn't run if there is more than 250 points totally. To disable this cap, set animationLimit to Infinity.

summary.p: The color of the border of each waterfall column.
In styled mode, the border stroke can be set with the .highcharts-point class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.BorderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the border surrounding each column or bar.

summary.p: The width of the border surrounding each column or bar.
In styled mode, the stroke width can be set with the .highcharts-point rule.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.ClassName
member.summary: A class name to apply to the series' graphical elements.

summary.p: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

In styled mode, the series color can be set with the .highcharts-series, .highcharts-color-{n}, .highcharts-{type}-series or .highcharts-series-{n} class, or individual classes given by the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.ColorByPoint
member.summary: When using automatic point colors pulled from the options.colors collection, this option determines whether the chart should receive one color per series or one color per point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Colors
member.summary: A series specific or series type specific color set to apply instead of the global colors when colorByPoint is true.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked.

summary.p:
A name for the dash style to use for the line connecting the columns of the waterfall series. Possible values:
Solid
ShortDash
ShortDot
ShortDashDot
ShortDashDotDot
Dot
Dash
LongDash
DashDot
LongDashDot
LongDashDotDot
In styled mode, the stroke dash-array can be set with the .highcharts-graph class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Depth
member.summary: Depth of the columns in a 3D column chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

summary.p: A description of the series to add to the screen reader information about the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.EdgeColor
member.summary: 3D columns only. The color of the edges. Similar to borderColor, except it defaults to the same color as the column.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.EdgeWidth
member.summary: 3D columns only. The width of the colored edges.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.EnableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.GetExtremesFromAll
member.summary: Whether to use the Y extremes of the total chart width or only the zoomed area when zooming in on parts of the X axis. By default, the Y axis adjusts to the min and max of the visible data. Cartesian series only.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.GroupPadding
member.summary: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.GroupZPadding
member.summary: The spacing between columns on the Z Axis in a 3D chart. Requires highcharts-3d.js.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Grouping
member.summary: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Keys
member.summary: An array specifying which option maps to which key in the data point array. This makes it convenient to work with unstructured data arrays from different sources.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.LegendIndex
member.summary:
The sequential index of the series in the legend.
Try it: Legend in opposite order .

summary.p: The color of the line that connects columns in a waterfall series.
In styled mode, the stroke can be set with the .highcharts-graph class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line connecting waterfall columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.LinkedTo
member.summary: The id of another series to link to. Additionally, the value can be ":previous" to link to the previous series. When two series are linked, only the first one appears in the legend. Toggling the visibility of this also toggles the linked series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.MaxPointWidth
member.summary: The maximum allowed pixel width for a column, translated to the height of a bar in a bar chart. This prevents the columns from becoming too wide when there is a small number of points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.MinPointLength
member.summary: The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

summary.p: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10.
Since Highcharts 4.1, it can be combined with pointIntervalUnit to draw irregular intervals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.PointIntervalUnit
member.summary: On datetime series, this allows for setting the pointInterval to irregular time units, day, month and year. A day is usually the same as 24 hours, but pointIntervalUnit also takes the DST crossover into consideration when dealing with local time. Combine this option with pointInterval to draw weeks, quarters, 6 months, 10 years etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.PointPadding
member.summary: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.PointRange
member.summary: The X axis range that each point is valid for. This determines the width of the column. On a categorized axis, the range will be 1 by default (one category unit). On linear and datetime axes, the range will be computed as the distance between the two closest data points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.PointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.PointWidth
member.summary: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the graph line. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.ShowCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.ShowInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. The default value is true for standalone series, false for linked series.

summary.p: When this is true, the series will not cause the Y axis to cross the zero plane (or threshold option) unless the data actually crosses the plane.
For example, if softThreshold is false, a series of 0, 1, 2, 3 will make the Y axis show negative values according to the minPadding option. If softThreshold is true, the Y axis starts at 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Stack
member.summary: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.States
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.StickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false and tooltip.shared is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true for line and area type series, but to false for columns, pies etc.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the columns, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. If null, the columns extend from the padding Y axis minimum.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip, but only the following properties can be defined on a series level.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component.

summary.p: The color used specifically for positive point columns. When not specified, the general series color is used.
In styled mode, the waterfall colors can be set with the .highcharts-point-negative, .highcharts-sum and .highcharts-intermediate-sum classes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.Visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.XAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.YAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to either the axis id or the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.ZIndex
member.summary: Define the visual z index of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeries.ZoneAxis
member.summary: Defines the Axis on which the zones are applied.

summary.p: An array defining zones within a series. Zones can be applied to the X axis, Y axis or Z axis for bubbles, according to the zoneAxis option.
In styled mode, the color zones are styled with the .highcharts-zone-{n} class, or custom classed from the className option (view live demo).

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.ClassName
member.summary: An additional, individual class name for the data point's graphic representation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Color
member.summary: Individual color for the point. By default the color is pulled from the global colors array.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.ColorIndex
member.summary: Styled mode only. A specific color index to use for the point, so its graphic representations are given the class name highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.DataLabels
member.summary: Individual data label for each point. The options are the same as the ones for plotOptions.series.dataLabels

summary.p: A description of the point to add to the screen reader information about the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Drilldown
member.summary: The id of a series in the drilldown.series array to use for a drilldown for this point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Events
member.summary: Individual point events

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Id
member.summary: An id for the point. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the point object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.IsIntermediateSum
member.summary: When this property is true, the points acts as a summary column for the values added or substracted since the last intermediate sum, or since the start of the series. The y value is ignored.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.IsSum
member.summary: When this property is true, the point display the total sum across the entire series. The y value is ignored.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Labelrank
member.summary: The rank for this point's data label in case of collision. If two data labels are about to overlap, only the one with the highest labelrank will be drawn.

summary.p: The name of the point as shown in the legend, tooltip, dataLabel etc.

If the xAxis.type is set to category, and no categories option exists, the category will be pulled from the point.name of the last series defined. For multiple series, best practice however is to define xAxis.categories.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Selected
member.summary: Whether the data point is selected initially.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.X
member.summary: The x value of the point. For datetime axes, the X value is the timestamp in milliseconds since 1970.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesData.Y
member.summary: The y value of the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Align
member.summary: The alignment of the data label compared to the point. If right, the right side of the label should be touching the point. For points with an extent, like columns, the alignments also dictates how to align it inside the box, as given with the inside option. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Whether to allow data labels to overlap. To make the labels less sensitive for overlapping, the dataLabels.padding can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.BackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.BorderColor
member.summary: The border color for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.BorderRadius
member.summary: The border radius in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.BorderWidth
member.summary: The border width in pixels for the data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the data label. Particularly in styled mode, this can be used to give each series' or point's data label unique styling. In addition to this option, a default color class name is added so that we can give the labels a contrast text shadow.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Color
member.summary: The text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Crop
member.summary: Whether to hide data labels that are outside the plot area. By default, the data label is moved inside the plot area according to the overflow option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Defer
member.summary: Whether to defer displaying the data labels until the initial series animation has finished.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the data labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Formatter
member.summary:
Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Note that if a format is defined, the format takes precedence and the formatter is ignored. Available data are:
this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total.
this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name.
this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name.
this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value.
this.x: The x value.
this.y: The y value.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Inside
member.summary: For points with an extent, like columns, whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Overflow
member.summary: How to handle data labels that flow outside the plot area. The default is justify, which aligns them inside the plot area. For columns and bars, this means it will be moved inside the bar. To display data labels outside the plot area, set crop to false and overflow to "none".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, thisis the padding within the box.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Text rotation in degrees. Note that due to a more complex structure, backgrounds, borders and padding will be lost on a rotated data label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Shape
member.summary: The name of a symbol to use for the border around the label. Symbols are predefined functions on the Renderer object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Style
member.summary: Styles for the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.VerticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of top, middle or bottom. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesDataLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the data labels. The default Z index puts it above the series. Use a Z index of 2 to display it behind the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.AfterAnimate
member.summary: Fires after the series has finished its initial animation, or in case animation is disabled, immediately as the series is displayed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.CheckboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. The checked item is found by event.item. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.Click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.Hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.LegendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesEvents.Show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPoint.Events
member.summary: Events for each single point

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.Click
member.summary:
Fires when a point is clicked. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.
If the series.allowPointSelect option is true, the default action for the point's click event is to toggle the point's select state. Returning false cancels this action.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.MouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.MouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the area close to the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.Remove
member.summary: Fires when the point is removed using the .remove() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.Select
member.summary: Fires when the point is selected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.Unselect
member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programmatically or following a click on the point. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesPointEvents.Update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStates.Hover
member.summary: Options for the hovered series

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStatesHover.Enabled
member.summary: Enable separate styles for the hovered series to visualize that the user hovers either the series itself or the legend..

summary.p: Options for the halo appearing around the hovered point in line-type series as well as outside the hovered slice in pie charts. By default the halo is filled by the current point or series color with an opacity of 0.25. The halo can be disabled by setting the halo option to false.
In styled mode, the halo is styled with the .highcharts-halo class, with colors inherited from .highcharts-color-{n}.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStatesHover.LineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStatesHover.LineWidthPlus
member.summary: The additional line width for the graph of a hovered series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of SVG attributes to override the appearance of the halo, for example fill, stroke and stroke-width.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity for the halo unless a specific fill is overridden using the attributes setting. Note that Highcharts is only able to apply opacity to colors of hex or rgb(a) formats.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesStatesHoverHalo.Size
member.summary: The pixel size of the halo. For point markers this is the radius of the halo. For pie slices it is the width of the halo outside the slice. For bubbles it defaults to 5 and is the width of the halo outside the bubble.

summary.p: For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.

Defaults to:{ millisecond:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S.%L", second:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M:%S", minute:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", hour:"%A, %b %e, %H:%M", day:"%A, %b %e, %Y", week:"Week from %A, %b %e, %Y", month:"%B %Y", year:"%Y"}

Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types.
For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.FollowTouchMove
member.summary: Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.FooterFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format.

summary.p: The HTML of the tooltip header line. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variablesare point.key, series.name, series.color and other members from the point and series objects. The point.key variable contains the category name, x value or datetime string depending on the type of axis. For datetime axes, the point.key date format can be set using tooltip.xDateFormat.
Defaults to {point.key}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.HideDelay
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.Padding
member.summary: Padding inside the tooltip, in pixels.

summary.p: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.valuePrefix and tooltip.valueSuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units.
In styled mode, the dot is colored by a class name rather than the point color.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.PointFormatter
member.summary: A callback function for formatting the HTML output for a single point in the tooltip. Like the pointFormat string, but with more flexibility.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.Split
member.summary: Split the tooltip into one label per series, with the header close to the axis. This is recommended over shared tooltips for charts with multiple line series, generally making them easier to read.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.ValueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.ValuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.ValueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesTooltip.XDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesZones.ClassName
member.summary: Styled mode only. A custom class name for the zone.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesZones.Color
member.summary: Defines the color of the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesZones.DashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesZones.FillColor
member.summary: Defines the fill color for the series (in area type series)

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.WaterfallSeriesZones.Value
member.summary: The value up to where the zone extends, if undefined the zones stretches to the last value in the series.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.AllowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals should be avoided in the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.AlternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Breaks
member.summary: An array defining breaks in the axis, the sections defined will be left out and all the points shifted closer to each other. Requires that the broken-axis.js module is loaded.

summary.p: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highcharts 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to category. However, if you have multiple series, best practice remains defining the categories array.
Example:categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to null

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Ceiling
member.summary: The highest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.ClassName
member.summary: A class name that opens for styling the axis by CSS, especially in Highcharts styled mode. The class name is applied to group elements for the grid, axis elements and labels.

summary.p: Configure a crosshair that follows either the mouse pointer or the hovered point.
In styled mode, the crosshairs are styled in the .highcharts-crosshair, .highcharts-crosshair-thin or .highcharts-xaxis-category classes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For intermediate values, different units may be used, for example the day unit can be used on midnight and hour unit be used for intermediate values on the same axis. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.Defaults to:{millisecond: '%H:%M:%S.%L',second: '%H:%M:%S',minute: '%H:%M',hour: '%H:%M',day: '%e. %b',week: '%e. %b',month: '%b \'%y',year: '%Y'}

summary.p: Description of the axis to screen reader users.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Events
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Floor
member.summary: The lowest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

summary.p: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.
In styled mode, the stroke is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.GridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

summary.p: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.GridZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the grid lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Labels
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

summary.p: The color of the line marking the axis itself.
In styled mode, the line stroke is given in the .highcharts-axis-line or .highcharts-xaxis-line class.
The width of the line marking the axis itself.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-axis-line or .highcharts-xaxis-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.LinkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

summary.p: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up.

If a tickAmount is set, the axis may be extended beyond the set max in order to reach the given number of ticks. The same may happen in a chart with multiple axes, determined by chart.alignTicks, where a tickAmount is applied internally.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' max option is set or a max extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the maxPadding will be ignored.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' min option is set or a min extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the minPadding will be ignored.

summary.p: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.
The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.
On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.
Note that the minPadding, maxPadding, startOnTick and endOnTick settings also affect how the extremes of the axis are computed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours. Defaults to the closest distance between two points on the axis.

summary.p: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-minor-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

summary.p: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.MinorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.NameToX
member.summary: Applies only when the axis type is category. When nameToX is true, points are placed on the X axis according to their names. If the same point name is repeated in the same or another series, the point is placed on the same X position as other points of the same name. When nameToX is false, the points are laid out in increasing X positions regardless of their names, and the X axis category will take the name of the last point in each position.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. With multiple axes the offset is dynamically adjusted to avoid collision, this can be overridden by setting offset explicitly.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

summary.p: An array of colored bands stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.
In a gauge, a plot band on the Y axis (value axis) will stretch along the perimeter of the gauge.
In styled mode, the plot bands are styled by the .highcharts-plot-band class in addition to the className option.
An array of lines stretching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.
In styled mode, the plot lines are styled by the .highcharts-plot-line class in addition to the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.ShowEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.ShowFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label.
