member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.SoftMax
member.summary: A soft maximum for the axis. If the series data maximum is greater than this, the axis will stay at this maximum, but if the series data maximum is higher, the axis will flex to show all data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.SoftMin
member.summary: A soft minimum for the axis. If the series data minimum is greater than this, the axis will stay at this minimum, but if the series data minimum is lower, the axis will flex to show all data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.StartOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the minPadding option to control the axis start.

summary.p: The amount of ticks to draw on the axis. This opens up for aligning the ticks of multiple charts or panes within a chart. This option overrides the tickPixelInterval option.
This option only has an effect on linear axes. Datetime, logarithmic or category axes are not affected.
Color for the main tick marks.
In styled mode, the stroke is given in the .highcharts-tick class.

The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.
If the tickInterval is too dense for labels to be drawn, Highcharts may remove ticks.
If the chart has multiple axes, the alignTicks option may interfere with the tickInterval setting.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.TickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.TickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 forthe X axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.TickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.TickPositioner
member.summary: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval. The automatic tick positions are accessible through this.tickPositions and can be modified by the callback.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.TickPositions
member.summary: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

summary.p: The pixel width of the major tick marks.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-tick class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.TickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If on the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if between the tick mark is placed between categories. The default is between if the tickInterval is 1, else on.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Title
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxis.Visible
member.summary: Whether axis, including axis title, line, ticks and labels, should be visible.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisBreaks.BreakSize
member.summary: A number indicating how much space should be left between the start and the end of the break. The break size is given in axis units, so for instance on a datetime axis, a break size of 3600000 would indicate the equivalent of an hour.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisBreaks.From
member.summary: The point where the break starts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisBreaks.Repeat
member.summary: Defines an interval after which the break appears again. By default the breaks do not repeat.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisBreaks.To
member.summary: The point where the break ends.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisCrosshair.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the crosshair, especially as a hook for styling.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisCrosshair.Color
member.summary: The color of the crosshair. Defaults to #cccccc for numeric and datetime axes, and rgba(204,214,235,0.25) for category axes, where the crosshair by default highlights the whole category.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisCrosshair.DashStyle
member.summary: The dash style for the crosshair. See series.dashStyle for possible values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisCrosshair.Snap
member.summary: Whether the crosshair should snap to the point or follow the pointer independent of points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisCrosshair.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of the crosshair. Defaults to 1 for numeric or datetime axes, and for one category width for category axes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisCrosshair.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the crosshair. Higher Z indices allow drawing the crosshair on top of the series or behind the grid lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisEvents.AfterBreaks
member.summary: An event fired after the breaks have rendered.

summary.p: As opposed to the setExtremes event, this event fires after the final min and max values are computed and corrected for minRange.

Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. These reflect the axis minimum and maximum in axis values. The actual data extremes are found in event.dataMin and event.dataMax.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisEvents.PointBreak
member.summary: An event fired when a break from this axis occurs on a point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisEvents.PointInBreak
member.summary: An event fired when a point falls inside a break from this axis.

summary.p: Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. These reflect the axis minimum and maximum in data values. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the "Reset zoom" button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to an intelligent guess based on which side of the chart the axis is on and the rotation of the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.AutoRotation
member.summary: For horizontal axes, the allowed degrees of label rotation to prevent overlapping labels. If there is enough space, labels are not rotated. As the chart gets narrower, it will start rotating the labels -45 degrees, then remove every second label and try again with rotations 0 and -45 etc. Set it to false to disable rotation, which will cause the labels to word-wrap if possible.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.AutoRotationLimit
member.summary: When each category width is more than this many pixels, we don't apply auto rotation. Instead, we lay out the axis label with word wrap. A lower limit makes sense when the label contains multiple short words that don't extend the available horizontal space for each label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Distance
member.summary: Polar charts only. The label's pixel distance from the perimeter of the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the axis labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the axis label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Formatter
member.summary: Callback JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.value. Additional properties for this are axis, chart, isFirst and isLast. Defaults to: function() {return this.value;}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Padding
member.summary: The pixel padding for axis labels, to ensure white space between them.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.ReserveSpace
member.summary: Whether to reserve space for the labels. This can be turned off when for example the labels are rendered inside the plot area instead of outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.StaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. .

summary.p: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?
CSS styles for the label. Use whiteSpace: 'nowrap' to prevent wrapping of category labels. Use textOverflow: 'none' to prevent ellipsis (dots).
In styled mode, the labels are styled with the .highcharts-axis-labels class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index for the axis labels.

member.summary: The z index of the plot band within the chart, relative to other elements. Using the same z index as another element may give unpredictable results, as the last rendered element will be on top. Values from 0 to 20 make sense.

summary.p: CSS styles for the text label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisTitle.Margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels or line and the title. Defaults to 0 for horizontal axes, 10 for vertical

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisTitle.Offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisTitle.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

summary.p: CSS styles for the title. When titles are rotated they are rendered using vector graphic techniques and not all styles are applicable.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-axis-title class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisTitle.Text
member.summary: The actual text of the axis title. It can contain basic HTML text markup like <b>, <i> and spans with style.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisTitle.X
member.summary: Horizontal pixel offset of the title position.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.XAxisTitle.Y
member.summary: Vertical pixel offset of the title position.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.AllowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals should be avoided in the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.AlternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Angle
member.summary: In a polar chart, this is the angle of the Y axis in degrees, where 0 is up and 90 is right. The angle determines the position of the axis line and the labels, though the coordinate system is unaffected.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Breaks
member.summary: An array defining breaks in the axis, the sections defined will be left out and all the points shifted closer to each other. Requires that the broken-axis.js module is loaded.

summary.p: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highcharts 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to category. However, if you have multiple series, best practice remains defining the categories array.
Example:categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to null

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Ceiling
member.summary: The highest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.ClassName
member.summary: A class name that opens for styling the axis by CSS, especially in Highcharts styled mode. The class name is applied to group elements for the grid, axis elements and labels.

summary.p: Configure a crosshair that follows either the mouse pointer or the hovered point.
In styled mode, the crosshairs are styled in the .highcharts-crosshair, .highcharts-crosshair-thin or .highcharts-xaxis-category classes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For intermediate values, different units may be used, for example the day unit can be used on midnight and hour unit be used for intermediate values on the same axis. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.Defaults to:{millisecond: '%H:%M:%S.%L',second: '%H:%M:%S',minute: '%H:%M',hour: '%H:%M',day: '%e. %b',week: '%e. %b',month: '%b \'%y',year: '%Y'}

summary.p: Description of the axis to screen reader users.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Floor
member.summary: The lowest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

summary.p: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.
In styled mode, the stroke is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.GridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.GridLineInterpolation
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether the grid lines should draw as a polygon with straight lines between categories, or as circles. Can be either circle or polygon.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.GridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.GridZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the grid lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get().

summary.p: The color of the line marking the axis itself.
In styled mode, the line stroke is given in the .highcharts-axis-line or .highcharts-xaxis-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.LineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.LinkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

summary.p: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up.

If a tickAmount is set, the axis may be extended beyond the set max in order to reach the given number of ticks. The same may happen in a chart with multiple axes, determined by chart.alignTicks, where a tickAmount is applied internally.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MaxColor
member.summary: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the maximum value of the Y axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

summary.p: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated.
If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.
The automatically calculated minimum value is also affected by floor, softMin, minPadding, minRange as well as series.threshold and series.softThreshold.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinColor
member.summary: Solid gauge only. Unless stops are set, the color to represent the minimum value of the Y axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area.

summary.p: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.
The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.
On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.
Note that the minPadding, maxPadding, startOnTick and endOnTick settings also affect how the extremes of the axis are computed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours. Defaults to the closest distance between two points on the axis.

summary.p: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-minor-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

summary.p: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.MinorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. With multiple axes the offset is dynamically adjusted to avoid collision, this can be overridden by setting offset explicitly.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.PlotBands
member.summary: An array of objects defining plot bands on the Y axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.PlotLines
member.summary: An array of objects representing plot lines on the X axis

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.ReversedStacks
member.summary: If true, the first series in a stack will be drawn on top in a positive, non-reversed Y axis. If false, the first series is in the base of the stack.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.ShowEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.ShowFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.SoftMax
member.summary: A soft maximum for the axis. If the series data maximum is greater than this, the axis will stay at this maximum, but if the series data maximum is higher, the axis will flex to show all data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.SoftMin
member.summary: A soft minimum for the axis. If the series data minimum is greater than this, the axis will stay at this minimum, but if the series data minimum is lower, the axis will flex to show all data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.StackLabels
member.summary: The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top ofpositive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.StartOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start.

summary.p: Solid gauge series only. Color stops for the solid gauge. Use this in cases where a linear gradient between a minColor and maxColor is not sufficient. The stops is an array of tuples, where the first item is a float between 0 and 1 assigning the relative position in the gradient, and the second item is the color.
For solid gauges, the Y axis also inherits the concept of data classes from the Highmaps color axis.
The amount of ticks to draw on the axis. This opens up for aligning the ticks of multiple charts or panes within a chart. This option overrides the tickPixelInterval option.
This option only has an effect on linear axes. Datetime, logarithmic or category axes are not affected.
Color for the main tick marks.
In styled mode, the stroke is given in the .highcharts-tick class.

The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.
If the tickInterval is too dense for labels to be drawn, Highcharts may remove ticks.
If the chart has multiple axes, the alignTicks option may interfere with the tickInterval setting.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 forthe X axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickPositioner
member.summary: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval. The automatic tick positions are accessible through this.tickPositions and can be modified by the callback.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickPositions
member.summary: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.TickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If on the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if between the tick mark is placed between categories. The default is between if the tickInterval is 1, else on.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxis.Visible
member.summary: Whether axis, including axis title, line, ticks and labels, should be visible.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisBreaks.BreakSize
member.summary: A number indicating how much space should be left between the start and the end of the break. The break size is given in axis units, so for instance on a datetime axis, a break size of 3600000 would indicate the equivalent of an hour.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisBreaks.From
member.summary: The point where the break starts.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisBreaks.Repeat
member.summary: Defines an interval after which the break appears again. By default the breaks do not repeat.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisBreaks.To
member.summary: The point where the break ends.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisCrosshair.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the crosshair, especially as a hook for styling.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisCrosshair.Color
member.summary: The color of the crosshair. Defaults to #cccccc for numeric and datetime axes, and rgba(204,214,235,0.25) for category axes, where the crosshair by default highlights the whole category.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisCrosshair.DashStyle
member.summary: The dash style for the crosshair. See series.dashStyle for possible values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisCrosshair.Snap
member.summary: Whether the crosshair should snap to the point or follow the pointer independent of points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisCrosshair.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of the crosshair. Defaults to 1 for numeric or datetime axes, and for one category width for category axes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisCrosshair.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the crosshair. Higher Z indices allow drawing the crosshair on top of the series or behind the grid lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisEvents.AfterBreaks
member.summary: An event fired after the breaks have rendered.

summary.p: As opposed to the setExtremes event, this event fires after the final min and max values are computed and corrected for minRange.

Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. These reflect the axis minimum and maximum in axis values. The actual data extremes are found in event.dataMin and event.dataMax.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisEvents.PointBreak
member.summary: An event fired when a break from this axis occurs on a point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisEvents.PointInBreak
member.summary: An event fired when a point falls inside a break from this axis.

summary.p: Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. These reflect the axis minimum and maximum in data values. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the "Reset zoom" button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". The exact position also depends on the labels.x setting. Angular gauges and solid gauges defaults to center.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.AutoRotation
member.summary: For horizontal axes, the allowed degrees of label rotation to prevent overlapping labels. If there is enough space, labels are not rotated. As the chart gets narrower, it will start rotating the labels -45 degrees, then remove every second label and try again with rotations 0 and -45 etc. Set it to false to disable rotation, which will cause the labels to word-wrap if possible.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.AutoRotationLimit
member.summary: When each category width is more than this many pixels, we don't apply auto rotation. Instead, we lay out the axis label with word wrap. A lower limit makes sense when the label contains multiple short words that don't extend the available horizontal space for each label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Distance
member.summary: Angular gauges and solid gauges only. The label's pixel distance from the perimeter of the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the axis labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the axis label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Formatter
member.summary: Callback JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.value. Additional properties for this are axis, chart, isFirst and isLast. Defaults to: function() {return this.value;}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Padding
member.summary: The pixel padding for axis labels, to ensure white space between them.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.ReserveSpace
member.summary: Whether to reserve space for the labels. This can be turned off when for example the labels are rendered inside the plot area instead of outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.StaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. .

summary.p: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?
CSS styles for the label. Use whiteSpace: 'nowrap' to prevent wrapping of category labels. Use textOverflow: 'none' to prevent ellipsis (dots).
In styled mode, the labels are styled with the .highcharts-axis-labels class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to -15 for left axis, 15 for right axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index for the axis labels.

member.summary: An id used for identifying the plot band in Axis.removePlotBand.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBands.InnerRadius
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option determines the inner radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "100%", or as a pixel number, like 100. By default, the inner radius is controlled by the thickness option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBands.Label
member.summary: Text labels for the plot bands

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBands.OuterRadius
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option determines the outer radius of the plot band that stretches along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "100%", or as a pixel number, like 100.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBands.Thickness
member.summary: In a gauge chart, this option sets the width of the plot band stretching along the perimeter. It can be given as a percentage string, like "10%", or as a pixel number, like 10. The default value 10 is the same as the default tickLength, thus making the plot band act as a background for the tick markers.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBands.To
member.summary: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBands.ZIndex
member.summary: The z index of the plot band within the chart, relative to other elements. Using the same z index as another element may give unpredictable results, as the last rendered element will be on top. Values from 0 to 20 make sense.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisPlotBandsLabel.Align

member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.summary: Enable or disable the stack total labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisStackLabels.TextAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed with regards to the stack, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisStackLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the left of the stacked bar. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisStackLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.Align
member.summary: Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values are "low", "middle" or "high".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.Margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels and the title. Positive values are outside the axis line, negative are inside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.Offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

summary.p: CSS styles for the title. When titles are rotated they are rendered using vector graphic techniques and not all styles are applicable.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-axis-title class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.Text
member.summary: The actual text of the axis title. Horizontal texts can contain HTML, but rotated texts are painted using vector techniques and must be clean text. The Y axis title is disabled by setting the text option to null.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.X
member.summary: Horizontal pixel offset of the title position.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.YAxisTitle.Y
member.summary: Vertical pixel offset of the title position.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.AllowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals should be avoided in the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.AlternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line.

summary.p: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Since Highcharts 3.0, categories can also be extracted by giving each point a name and setting axis type to category. However, if you have multiple series, best practice remains defining the categories array.
Example:categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to null

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Ceiling
member.summary: The highest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.ClassName
member.summary: A class name that opens for styling the axis by CSS, especially in Highcharts styled mode. The class name is applied to group elements for the grid, axis elements and labels.

summary.p: Configure a crosshair that follows either the mouse pointer or the hovered point.
In styled mode, the crosshairs are styled in the .highcharts-crosshair, .highcharts-crosshair-thin or .highcharts-xaxis-category classes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.DateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For intermediate values, different units may be used, for example the day unit can be used on midnight and hour unit be used for intermediate values on the same axis. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat.Defaults to:{millisecond: '%H:%M:%S.%L',second: '%H:%M:%S',minute: '%H:%M',hour: '%H:%M',day: '%e. %b',week: '%e. %b',month: '%b \'%y',year: '%Y'}

summary.p: Description of the axis to screen reader users.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.EndOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Events
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Floor
member.summary: The lowest allowed value for automatically computed axis extremes.

summary.p: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.
In styled mode, the stroke is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.GridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

summary.p: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.GridZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the grid lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get().

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Labels
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

summary.p: The color of the line marking the axis itself.
In styled mode, the line stroke is given in the .highcharts-axis-line or .highcharts-xaxis-line class.
The width of the line marking the axis itself.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-axis-line or .highcharts-xaxis-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.LinkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales.

summary.p: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up.

If a tickAmount is set, the axis may be extended beyond the set max in order to reach the given number of ticks. The same may happen in a chart with multiple axes, determined by chart.alignTicks, where a tickAmount is applied internally.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MaxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' max option is set or a max extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the maxPadding will be ignored.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' min option is set or a min extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the minPadding will be ignored.

summary.p: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour.
The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points.
On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.
Note that the minPadding, maxPadding, startOnTick and endOnTick settings also affect how the extremes of the axis are computed.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours. Defaults to the closest distance between two points on the axis.

summary.p: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-minor-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration.

summary.p: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-grid-line class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.MinorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.NameToX
member.summary: Applies only when the axis type is category. When nameToX is true, points are placed on the X axis according to their names. If the same point name is repeated in the same or another series, the point is placed on the same X position as other points of the same name. When nameToX is false, the points are laid out in increasing X positions regardless of their names, and the X axis category will take the name of the last point in each position.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. With multiple axes the offset is dynamically adjusted to avoid collision, this can be overridden by setting offset explicitly.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes.

summary.p: An array of colored bands stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.
In a gauge, a plot band on the Y axis (value axis) will stretch along the perimeter of the gauge.
In styled mode, the plot bands are styled by the .highcharts-plot-band class in addition to the className option.
An array of lines stretching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.
In styled mode, the plot lines are styled by the .highcharts-plot-line class in addition to the className option.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to the origin. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.ShowEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.ShowFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.ShowLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.SoftMax
member.summary: A soft maximum for the axis. If the series data maximum is greater than this, the axis will stay at this maximum, but if the series data maximum is higher, the axis will flex to show all data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.SoftMin
member.summary: A soft minimum for the axis. If the series data minimum is greater than this, the axis will stay at this minimum, but if the series data minimum is lower, the axis will flex to show all data.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.StartOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.StartOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the minPadding option to control the axis start.

summary.p: The amount of ticks to draw on the axis. This opens up for aligning the ticks of multiple charts or panes within a chart. This option overrides the tickPixelInterval option.
This option only has an effect on linear axes. Datetime, logarithmic or category axes are not affected.
Color for the main tick marks.
In styled mode, the stroke is given in the .highcharts-tick class.

The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000.

On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc.
If the tickInterval is too dense for labels to be drawn, Highcharts may remove ticks.
If the chart has multiple axes, the alignTicks option may interfere with the tickInterval setting.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.TickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.TickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 forthe X axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.TickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.TickPositioner
member.summary: A callback function returning array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval. The automatic tick positions are accessible through this.tickPositions and can be modified by the callback.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.TickPositions
member.summary: An array defining where the ticks are laid out on the axis. This overrides the default behaviour of tickPixelInterval and tickInterval.

summary.p: The pixel width of the major tick marks.
In styled mode, the stroke width is given in the .highcharts-tick class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.TickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If on the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if between the tick mark is placed between categories. The default is between if the tickInterval is 1, else on.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Title
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxis.Visible
member.summary: Whether axis, including axis title, line, ticks and labels, should be visible.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisCrosshair.ClassName
member.summary: A class name for the crosshair, especially as a hook for styling.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisCrosshair.Color
member.summary: The color of the crosshair. Defaults to #cccccc for numeric and datetime axes, and rgba(204,214,235,0.25) for category axes, where the crosshair by default highlights the whole category.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisCrosshair.DashStyle
member.summary: The dash style for the crosshair. See series.dashStyle for possible values.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisCrosshair.Snap
member.summary: Whether the crosshair should snap to the point or follow the pointer independent of points.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisCrosshair.Width
member.summary: The pixel width of the crosshair. Defaults to 1 for numeric or datetime axes, and for one category width for category axes.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisCrosshair.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index of the crosshair. Higher Z indices allow drawing the crosshair on top of the series or behind the grid lines.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisEvents.AfterBreaks
member.summary: An event fired after the breaks have rendered.

summary.p: As opposed to the setExtremes event, this event fires after the final min and max values are computed and corrected for minRange.

Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. These reflect the axis minimum and maximum in axis values. The actual data extremes are found in event.dataMin and event.dataMax.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisEvents.PointBreak
member.summary: An event fired when a break from this axis occurs on a point.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisEvents.PointInBreak
member.summary: An event fired when a point falls inside a break from this axis.

summary.p: Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max. These reflect the axis minimum and maximum in data values. When an axis is zoomed all the way out from the "Reset zoom" button, event.min and event.max are null, and the new extremes are set based on this.dataMin and this.dataMax.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to an intelligent guess based on which side of the chart the axis is on and the rotation of the label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.AutoRotation
member.summary: For horizontal axes, the allowed degrees of label rotation to prevent overlapping labels. If there is enough space, labels are not rotated. As the chart gets narrower, it will start rotating the labels -45 degrees, then remove every second label and try again with rotations 0 and -45 etc. Set it to false to disable rotation, which will cause the labels to word-wrap if possible.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.AutoRotationLimit
member.summary: When each category width is more than this many pixels, we don't apply auto rotation. Instead, we lay out the axis label with word wrap. A lower limit makes sense when the label contains multiple short words that don't extend the available horizontal space for each label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Distance
member.summary: Polar charts only. The label's pixel distance from the perimeter of the plot area.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the axis labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Format
member.summary: A format string for the axis label.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Formatter
member.summary: Callback JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.value. Additional properties for this are axis, chart, isFirst and isLast. Defaults to: function() {return this.value;}

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Padding
member.summary: The pixel padding for axis labels, to ensure white space between them.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.ReserveSpace
member.summary: Whether to reserve space for the labels. This can be turned off when for example the labels are rendered inside the plot area instead of outside.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.StaggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. .

summary.p: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label.

By default, the step is calculated automatically to avoid overlap. To prevent this, set it to 1. This usually only happens on a category axis, and is often a sign that you have chosen the wrong axis type. Read more at Axis docs => What axis should I use?
CSS styles for the label. Use whiteSpace: 'nowrap' to prevent wrapping of category labels. Use textOverflow: 'none' to prevent ellipsis (dots).
In styled mode, the labels are styled with the .highcharts-axis-labels class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.UseHTML
member.summary: Whether to use HTML to render the labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.X
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.Y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default makes it adapt to the font size on bottom axis.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisLabels.ZIndex
member.summary: The Z index for the axis labels.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBands.BorderColor
member.summary: Border color for the plot band. Also requires borderWidth to be set.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBands.BorderWidth
member.summary: Border width for the plot band. Also requires borderColor to be set.

member.summary: An id used for identifying the plot band in Axis.removePlotBand.

member.summary: Text labels for the plot bands

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBands.To
member.summary: The end position of the plot band in axis units.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBands.ZIndex
member.summary: The z index of the plot band within the chart, relative to other elements. Using the same z index as another element may give unpredictable results, as the last rendered element will be on top. Values from 0 to 20 make sense.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBandsLabel.Align
member.summary: Horizontal alignment of the label. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBandsLabel.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the text label in degrees .

summary.p: CSS styles for the text label.
In styled mode, the labels are styled by the .highcharts-plot-band-label class.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBandsLabel.Text
member.summary: The string text itself. A subset of HTML is supported.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBandsLabel.TextAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to the same as the align option.

member.summary: Horizontal position relative the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisPlotBandsLabel.Y
member.summary: Vertical position of the text baseline relative to the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisTitle.Offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this.

member.name: P:Highsoft.Web.Mvc.Charts.ZAxisTitle.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top.

summary.p: CSS styles for the title. When titles are rotated they are rendered using vector graphic techniques and not all styles are applicable.
